intro: Seriphidium tecti-mundi, commonly known as the "cup-shaped wormwood," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has finely divided, silvery-green leaves that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for rocky or arid environments. Its unique appearance and medicinal properties have made it a subject of botanical interest.
